00023    /* 
00024    * Constructor.

00026    CfbRebridgeBase::CfbRebridgeBase(McSystem& system) : 
00027       CfbEndBase(system),
00028       length21_(1.0),
00029       length10_(1.0),
00030       kappa10_(0.0)
00031    {
00032       #ifdef MCMD_NOMASKBONDED
00033       UTIL_THROW("CfbRebridgeBase is unusable ifdef MCMD_NOMASKBONDED");
00034       #endif
00035    }

00042    /* 
00043    * 
00044    */
00045    void CfbRebridgeBase::readParam(std::istream& in) 
00046    {
00047       // Number of trial configuration bias attempts.
00048       read<int>(in, "nTrial", nTrial_);
00049       if (nTrial_ <=0 || nTrial_ > MaxTrial_) {
00050          UTIL_THROW("Invalid value input for nTrial");
00051       }
00052 
00053       // Parameters needed by orientation bias.
00054       read<double>(in, "length21", length21_);
00055       read<double>(in, "length10", length10_);
00056       read<double>(in, "kappa10", kappa10_);
00057    }
00058 
00059    /* 
00060    * Initialize tables for spring constants and normalizations.
00061    */
00062    void CfbRebridgeBase::setup()
00063    {
00064       double l20;
00065       double lmin, lmax, del, pi;
00066       int    i;
00067    
00068       pi = acos(-1.0);
00069    
00070       // Range of l_20; 2.0 is empirical.
00071       lmax = 2.0 * (length10_ + length21_);
00072    
00073       // Fill table elements for: l_20 <= lmin
00074       if (length21_ == length10_) {
00075          // 0.1 is empirical.
00076          lmin = length10_ / length21_ / sqrt(kappa10_) * 0.1;
00077          l20Table[0]    = lmin;
00078          angTable[0]    = pi/2.0;
00079          kappaTable[0]  = 0.0;
00080          normalTable[0] = 2.0;
00081       } else {
00082          // 0.5 is empirical.
00083          lmin = fabs(length10_ - length21_) * 0.5;
00084          l20Table[0] = lmin;
00085          orientationBiasTable(lmin, angTable[0], kappaTable[0], normalTable[0]);
00086       }
00087    
00088       // Fill table elements for: lmin < l_20 < lmax
00089       del  = (lmax - lmin) / double(MaxBin_-2);
00090       l20  = lmin - del/2.0;
00091       for (i=1; i<MaxBin_-1; i++) {
00092          l20 += del;
00093          l20Table[i] = l20;
00094          orientationBiasTable(l20, angTable[i], kappaTable[i], normalTable[i]);
00095       }
00096    
00097       // Fill table elements for: l_20 >= lmax
00098       l20Table[MaxBin_-1]    = lmax;
00099       angTable[MaxBin_-1]    = 0.0;
00100       kappaTable[MaxBin_-1]  = kappa10_ * length21_ * lmax;
00101       computeNormalization(angTable[MaxBin_-1], kappaTable[MaxBin_-1], 
00102                            normalTable[MaxBin_-1]);
00103    }
00104    
00105    /* 
00106    * Configuration bias algorithm for deleting the last particle of an interior
00107    * bridge. 
00108    *
00109    *                     1 
00110    *                      o-----o 0
00111    *                     /
00112    *                    o
00113    *                    2
00114    *         2 = prev, 0 = next, 1 = crank-shaft rotating
00115    *
00116    * Note that in the current implementation, the end atom position will be
00117    * modified, so the calling subroutine is responsible for recovering the old
00118    * position if necessary. This is similar to the implementation of
00119    * CfbEndBase::deleteEndAtom.
00120    */
00121    void CfbRebridgeBase::deleteMiddleAtom(
00122                 Atom* partPtr, Atom* prevPtr, Atom* nextPtr,
00123                 int prevBType, int nextBType,
00124                 double &rosenbluth, double &energy)
00125    {
00126       Vector  prevPos = prevPtr->position();
00127       Vector  nextPos = nextPtr->position();
00128       Vector  partPos = partPtr->position();
00129       Vector  bondVec, trialPos, u_20, u_21;
00130       double  trialEnergy, bondEnergy, wExt, length, lengthSq;
00131       double  l_20, l_21, l_10, bias;
00132       double  prefAng, kappaAng, normConst;
00133       int     iTrial;
00134       bool    ready;
00135       
00136       // Bond length and bonding vector 2 --> 0
00137       lengthSq = boundary().distanceSq(nextPos, prevPos, u_20);
00138       l_20  = sqrt(lengthSq);
00139       u_20 /= l_20;
00140    
00141       // Bond length and bonding vector 2 --> 1 & bonding energy
00142       lengthSq = boundary().distanceSq(partPos, prevPos, u_21);
00143       l_21  = sqrt(lengthSq);
00144       u_21 /= l_21;
00145       energy = system().bondPotential().energy(lengthSq, prevBType);
00146    
00147       // Bond length between 1 and 0 & bonding energy
00148       lengthSq   = boundary().distanceSq(partPos, nextPos);
00149       l_10       = sqrt(lengthSq);
00150       bondEnergy = system().bondPotential().energy(lengthSq, nextBType);
00151       energy    += bondEnergy;
00152    
00153       // Nonbonded pair energy of current position 
00154       #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00155       trialEnergy = system().pairPotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00156       #else
00157       trialEnergy = 0.0;
00158       #endif
00159 
00160       #ifdef INTER_ANGLE
00161       if (system().hasAnglePotential()) {
00162          trialEnergy += system().anglePotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00163       }
00164       #endif
00165 
00166       #ifdef INTER_EXTERNAL
00167       if (system().hasExternalPotential()) {
00168          trialEnergy += system().externalPotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00169       }
00170       #endif
00171 
00172       energy += trialEnergy;
00173     
00174       // Compute orientation/Angle bias factor and the normalization factor.
00175       getAngKappaNorm(l_20, prefAng, kappaAng, normConst);
00176       orientationBias(u_21, u_20, prefAng, kappaAng, bias);
00177    
00178       // remove normalized orientation bias
00179       rosenbluth = normConst / bias;
00180    
00181       // start to accumulate Rosenbluth factor
00182       wExt = boltzmann(trialEnergy + bondEnergy);
00183       
00184       // Generate "nTrial-1" trial positions based on 1-0 bonding.
00185       length = l_21;
00186       for (iTrial=0; iTrial < nTrial_ - 1; iTrial++) {
00187          ready = false;
00188          while (!ready) {
00189             random().unitVector(bondVec);
00190             bondVec *= length;
00191             trialPos.add(prevPos, bondVec);
00192             boundary().shift(trialPos);
00193    
00194             lengthSq = boundary().distanceSq(trialPos, prevPos, u_21);
00195             l_21  = sqrt(lengthSq);
00196             u_21 /= l_21;
00197             orientationBias(u_21, u_20, prefAng, kappaAng, bias);
00198    
00199           // Rejection method
00200           if (bias > random().uniform(0.0, 1.0)) {
00201                ready = true;
00202             }
00203          }
00204          
00205          // Bond 1-0 potential energy
00206          lengthSq   = boundary().distanceSq(trialPos, nextPos);
00207          bondEnergy = system().bondPotential().energy(lengthSq, nextBType);
00208          partPtr->position() = trialPos;
00209          #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00210          trialEnergy = system().pairPotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00211          #else
00212          trialEnergy = 0.0;
00213          #endif
00214 
00215          #ifdef INTER_ANGLE
00216          if (system().hasAnglePotential()) {
00217             trialEnergy += system().anglePotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00218          }
00219          #endif
00220 
00221          #ifdef INTER_EXTERNAL
00222          if (system().hasExternalPotential()) {
00223             trialEnergy += system().externalPotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00224          }
00225          #endif
00226 
00227          wExt += boltzmann(trialEnergy + bondEnergy);
00228       }
00229    
00230       // Update Rosenbluth weight (orientation bias has been removed earlier)
00231       rosenbluth *= wExt;
00232    
00233    }
00234    
00235    /* 
00236    * Configuration bias algorithm for adding the last particle of an interior
00237    * bridge. 
00238    */
00239    void CfbRebridgeBase::addMiddleAtom(
00240                  Atom* partPtr, Atom* prevPtr, Atom* nextPtr,
00241                  int prevBType, int nextBType,
00242                  double &rosenbluth, double &energy)
00243    {
00244       Vector  prevPos = prevPtr->position();
00245       Vector  nextPos = nextPtr->position();
00246       Vector  u_20, u_21, bondVec;
00247       Vector  trialPos[MaxTrial_];
00248       double  trialEnergy[MaxTrial_], bondEnergy[MaxTrial_];
00249       double  trialProb[MaxTrial_], bias[MaxTrial_];
00250       double  l_20, l_21;
00251       double  beta, length, lengthSq, wExt;
00252       double  prefAng, kappaAng, normConst;
00253       int     iTrial;
00254       bool    ready;
00255 
00256       // Bond 2 --> 0
00257       lengthSq = boundary().distanceSq(nextPos, prevPos, u_20);
00258       l_20     = sqrt(lengthSq);
00259       u_20 /= l_20;
00260  
00261       // Bond 2-1 & bonding energy
00262       beta   = energyEnsemble().beta();
00263       length = system().bondPotential().
00264                randomBondLength(&random(), beta, prevBType);
00265       l_21   = length;
00266       energy = system().bondPotential().energy(l_21*l_21, prevBType);
00267    
00268       // Loop over trial orientations
00269       wExt = 0.0;
00270       
00271       // Compute normalization factor for the orientation bias.
00272       getAngKappaNorm(l_20, prefAng, kappaAng, normConst);
00273    
00274       // Generating trial orientations
00275       for (iTrial=0; iTrial < nTrial_; iTrial++) {
00276          ready = false;
00277          while (!ready) {
00278             random().unitVector(bondVec);
00279             bondVec *= length;
00280             trialPos[iTrial].add(prevPos, bondVec);
00281             boundary().shift(trialPos[iTrial]);
00282    
00283             lengthSq = boundary().distanceSq(trialPos[iTrial], prevPos, u_21);
00284             l_21  = sqrt(lengthSq);
00285             u_21 /= l_21;
00286             orientationBias(u_21, u_20, prefAng, kappaAng, bias[iTrial]);
00287    
00288           // Rejection method
00289           if (bias[iTrial] > random().uniform(0.0, 1.0)) {
00290                ready = true;
00291             }
00292          }
00293          
00294          // Bond 1-0 potential energy 
00295          lengthSq = boundary().distanceSq(trialPos[iTrial], nextPos);
00296          bondEnergy[iTrial] = 
00297             system().bondPotential().energy(lengthSq, nextBType);
00298          partPtr->position() = trialPos[iTrial];
00299 
00300          #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00301          trialEnergy[iTrial] = system().pairPotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00302          #else
00303          trialEnergy[iTrial] = 0.0;
00304          #endif
00305 
00306          #ifdef INTER_ANGLE
00307          if (system().hasAnglePotential()) {
00308             trialEnergy[iTrial] += 
00309                   system().anglePotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00310          }
00311          #endif
00312 
00313          #ifdef INTER_EXTERNAL
00314          if (system().hasExternalPotential()) {
00315             trialEnergy[iTrial] += 
00316                   system().externalPotential().atomEnergy(*partPtr);
00317          }
00318          #endif
00319 
00320          trialProb[iTrial] =
00321             boltzmann(trialEnergy[iTrial] + bondEnergy[iTrial]);
00322          wExt += trialProb[iTrial];
00323       }
00324    
00325       // Normalize trial probabilities 
00326       for (iTrial=0; iTrial < nTrial_; iTrial++) {
00327          trialProb[iTrial] = trialProb[iTrial] / wExt;
00328       }
00329      
00330       // Choose trial position
00331       iTrial = random().drawFrom(trialProb, nTrial_);
00332    
00333       // Add non-bonded pair energy for chosen trial
00334       energy += trialEnergy[iTrial];
00335       
00336       // Add 1-0 bond energy
00337       energy += bondEnergy[iTrial];
00338       
00339       // Copy trial position to newPos
00340       partPtr->position() = trialPos[iTrial];
00341    
00342       // update Rosenbluth weight and remove the orientation bias
00343       rosenbluth = wExt * normConst / bias[iTrial];
00344    }

00347    /* 
00348    * Delete a consequtive sequence of atoms.
00349    */
00350    void CfbRebridgeBase::deleteSequence(int nActive, int sign, Atom* endPtr,
00351               int *bonds, double &rosenbluth, double &energy)
00352    {
00353       Atom   *thisPtr;
00354       Atom   *prevPtr;
00355       Atom   *nextPtr;
00356       int     prevBType, nextBType;
00357       double  rosen_r, energy_r;
00358 
00359       // Initialize weight
00360       rosenbluth = 1.0;
00361       energy = 0.0;
00362 
00363       thisPtr = endPtr;
00364       prevPtr = thisPtr - sign;
00365       nextPtr = thisPtr + sign;
00366       // Step 1: delete the last atom
00367       if (nActive >= 1) {
00368          nextBType = bonds[0];
00369          prevBType = bonds[1];
00370  
00371          // Orientation biased trimer rebridge move
00372          deleteMiddleAtom(thisPtr, prevPtr, nextPtr,
00373                 prevBType, nextBType, rosen_r, energy_r);
00374          #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00375          system().pairPotential().deleteAtom(*thisPtr);
00376          #endif
00377          rosenbluth *= rosen_r;
00378          energy += energy_r;
00379       }
00380 
00381       // step 2: delete the remaining atoms
00382       for (int i = 0; i < nActive - 1; ++i) {
00383          thisPtr -= sign;
00384          prevPtr -= sign;
00385 
00386          prevBType = bonds[i+2];
00387          deleteEndAtom(thisPtr, prevPtr, prevBType, rosen_r, energy_r);
00388          #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00389          system().pairPotential().deleteAtom(*thisPtr);
00390          #endif
00391 
00392          rosenbluth *= rosen_r;
00393          energy += energy_r;
00394       }
00395 
00396    }
00397 
00398    /* 
00399    * Add a consequtive sequence of atoms.
00400    */
00401    void CfbRebridgeBase::addSequence(int nActive, int sign, Atom* beginPtr,
00402               int *bonds, double &rosenbluth, double &energy)
00403    {
00404       Atom   *thisPtr;
00405       Atom   *prevPtr;
00406       Atom   *nextPtr;
00407       int     prevBType, nextBType;
00408       double  rosen_f, energy_f;
00409 
00410       // Initialize weight
00411       rosenbluth = 1.0;
00412       energy = 0.0;
00413 
00414       // Step 1: grow the first nActive - 1 atoms
00415       thisPtr = beginPtr;
00416       prevPtr = thisPtr - sign;
00417 
00418       for (int i = 0; i < nActive - 1; ++i) {
00419          prevBType = bonds[nActive - i];
00420          addEndAtom(thisPtr, prevPtr, prevBType, rosen_f, energy_f);
00421          #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00422          system().pairPotential().addAtom(*thisPtr);
00423          #endif
00424 
00425          rosenbluth *= rosen_f;
00426          energy += energy_f;
00427 
00428          thisPtr += sign;
00429          prevPtr += sign;
00430       }
00431 
00432       // Step 2: grow the last atoms
00433       if (nActive >= 1) {
00434          prevPtr = thisPtr - sign;
00435          nextPtr = thisPtr + sign;
00436          prevBType = bonds[1];
00437          nextBType = bonds[0];
00438 
00439          // Invoke the orientation biased trimer re-bridging move
00440          addMiddleAtom(thisPtr, prevPtr, nextPtr,
00441                 prevBType, nextBType, rosen_f, energy_f);
00442          #ifndef INTER_NOPAIR
00443          system().pairPotential().addAtom(*thisPtr);
00444          #endif
00445 
00446          rosenbluth *= rosen_f;
00447          energy += energy_f;
00448       }
00449 
00450    }
00451    
00452    /* 
00453    * First determine the preferential orientation angle and angle biasing
00454    * spring constant; then compute the statistical weight for the biasing
00455    * function using Simpson's rule:
00456    *
00457    * Note: the variou branches represent certain geometrical extreme
00458    * situations.
00459    */
00460    void CfbRebridgeBase::orientationBiasTable
00461          (double l_20, double &prefAng, double &kappaAng, double &normConst)
00462    {
00463       double cos_ang;
00464    
00465       // Preferential orientation & effective spring constant
00466       if ( l_20 <= fabs(length21_ - length10_) ) {
00467    
00468          if (length21_ > length10_) {
00469             prefAng   = 0.0;
00470             kappaAng  = kappa10_ * (length21_ - l_20 - length10_);
00471             kappaAng *= length21_ * l_20 / (length21_ - l_20);
00472          } else if (length21_ == length10_) {
00473             prefAng   = acos(-1.0)/2.0;
00474             kappaAng  = 0.0;
00475          } else {
00476             prefAng   = acos(-1.0);
00477             kappaAng  = kappa10_ * (length10_ - l_20 - length21_);
00478             kappaAng *= length21_ * l_20 / (length21_ + l_20);
00479          }
00480    
00481       } else if ( l_20 >= (length21_ + length10_) ) { 
00482    
00483          prefAng  = 0.0;           
00484     kappaAng = kappa10_ * (l_20 - length21_ - length10_) * length21_ * l_20
00485                      / (l_20 - length21_);      
00486    
00487       } else {
00488    
00489          cos_ang  = (l_20*l_20 + length21_*length21_ - length10_*length10_)
00490                     * 0.5 / length21_ / l_20;
00491          prefAng  = acos(cos_ang);
00492          kappaAng = length21_ * l_20 / length10_;
00493          kappaAng = kappa10_ * kappaAng * kappaAng * (1.0 - cos_ang*cos_ang);
00494    
00495       }
00496    
00497       // Calculate normalization factor.
00498       if (kappaAng < 1.0E-7) {
00499          normConst = 2.0;
00500       } else {
00501          computeNormalization(prefAng, kappaAng, normConst);
00502       }
00503    }
00504 
00505    /* 
00506    * Use Simpson's rule to compute the normalization factor
00507    *   int { exp(-0.5*beta*kappaAng*(x-prefAng)**2)*sin(x) , {x, 0, pi} }
00508    */
00509    void CfbRebridgeBase::computeNormalization
00510       (double prefAng, double kappaAng, double &normConst)
00511    {
00512       int    i, N;                     // N must be even
00513       double delta, x, sum, tmp;
00514    
00515       // indices for Simpson's rule: 0,1,...,N
00516       N     = 400;                     // default value
00517       tmp   = 0.5*kappaAng;
00518       delta = acos(-1.0)/double(N);
00519    
00520       // the end points contribute nothing since sin(0)=sin(pi)=0.
00521       sum   = 0.0;
00522       x     = -delta;
00523       for (i=0; i < N-1; i=i+2) {
00524          x += delta;
00525          //sum += 2.0 * exp( -tmp * (x-prefAng)*(x-prefAng) ) * sin(x);
00526          sum += 2.0 * boltzmann( tmp * (x-prefAng)*(x-prefAng) ) * sin(x);
00527          x += delta;
00528          //sum += 4.0 * exp( -tmp * (x-prefAng)*(x-prefAng) ) * sin(x);
00529          sum += 4.0 * boltzmann( tmp * (x-prefAng)*(x-prefAng) ) * sin(x);
00530       }
00531       normConst = delta*sum/3.0;
00532    }
00533
